content.raw:
you should see orange overlays which represent the object's 'collisions'. An object can have a visual and a collision. A visual is just it's graphical representation (no physics), whereas a collision is it's rigid body representation that is used in gazebo's physics engine.

Sometimes the object's collision shape doesn't necessary match it's visual shape, so turning it on helps users to understand this difference.
content.html:
you should see orange overlays which represent the object's 'collisions'. An object can have a visual and a collision. A visual is just it's graphical representation (no physics), whereas a collision is it's rigid body representation that is used in gazebo's physics engine.

Sometimes the object's collision shape doesn't necessary match it's visual shape, so turning it on helps users to understand this difference.
